resources.string: Intensity of the blue light to be filtered out. Higher value means higher intensity of blue light will be filtered out, lower value means lower intensity of blue light will be filtered out.
Intensity of the green light to be filtered out. Here the range of control is limited. Filtering out green light will give a reddish tint to the screen.
Master switch to enable/disable Night Light.
Root access is needed for Night Light to work.
Your kernel does not support KCAL. KCAL is a display driver tuning feature for Qualcomm devices. KCAL support is needed for Night Light to work.
Automatically enable Night Light between the specified time. Night Light will be automatically disabled outside this time range.

Night Light uses KCAL, which is a display driver tuning feature for new generation Qualcomm devices, to adjust the intensity of blue light, which makes it more comfortable for your eyes when you are using your phone in the dark and helps you fall asleep. Since it makes changes at driver level, and it does not use any software overlays, it is battery friendly and the change can be seen everywhere on the display.
This will force enable/disable Night Light, disregarding the automatic schedule.
Unable to get your last known location.

If you like this app, you can consider getting the donation version of the app. Although it comes with no extra features than this version, it shows your support and appreciation to the app, and it will motivate the developer and support the development of the app :)
Tap to see who else contributed to this project.
Value of the color temperature to be set. Lower temperatures are better suitable for low light viewing.
Set the delay after which Night Light settings will be restored and applied after boot. Night Light settings will be applied after %s delay.
Looks like Night Light settings were restored but could not be applied after most recent boot. Consider increasing this delay so that settings can be successfully restored and applied after boot.
Please enable Automatic switch to use advanced automation features.
You can configure your old KCAL settings here. These settings will applied when night light is turned off.
This feature adjusts the Night Light colour temperature accordingly within the automatic time period.

Maximum temperature from which temperature will start scaling down. This temperature will be applied during the start of the schedule, and then it will gradually decrease. Lower temperatures are better suited for viewing at night.

Minimum temperature which will be applied at the peak time of the schedule. This temperature must be lesser than the maximum temperature setting, as temperature settings will gradually scale down from maximum temperature setting.

Temperatures will gradually decrease during this period, and Night Light settings based on those temperatures will be applied at equal interval of times. This period will start scaling down from the maximum temperature setting and scale down until it reaches the minimum temperature setting.
Night Light settings will remain constant during this period of time. The value of colour temperature applied during this period is that of minimum color temperature.

Temperatures will gradually increase during this period from minimum temperature to maximum temperature, and Night Light settings based on those temperatures will be applied at equal interval of times. These values are automatically calculated from scale down and peak time values.
Choose the time interval for applying the new Night Light settings.
